title: Chapter 1: The White Lightsaber
content:
The cantina on Lothal was loud, smelling of ozone and cheap grease. Ahsoka sat in the back, her hood pulled low over her montrals.

She wasn't looking for a fight. She rarely was these days. But the Empire had a way of finding fights and bringing them to your doorstep.

'Check the ID,' a Stormtrooper barked near the entrance.

Ahsoka's hand drifted not to a weapon, but to the empty space on her belt where one used to be. She took a breath. I am no Jedi, she reminded herself. But the Force hummed in her ears, warning of a bolt distinct from a blaster—the hum of a red blade approaching.

title: Chapter 2: The Shadow Child
content:
The alleyway was dark, but to the child, the shadows were solid. Defensive.

'Stay back!' the boy shouted. He didn't push with the Force; he pulled. The shadows leaped from the walls, wrapping around the Inquisitor's legs like physical vines.

Ahsoka dropped from the rooftop, her white blades igniting with a hiss that silenced the wind. 'Let him go,' she stated, her voice calm amidst the gathering storm.

The Inquisitor laughed, a mechanical, grating sound. 'A survivor? Good. The Grand Inquisitor will be pleased.'
